title: Bi-quadratic P\'{o}lya fields with five distinct ramified primes
authors: Md. Imdadul Islam, Jaitra Chattopadhyay and Debopam Chakraborty
abstract:
For an algebraic number field $K$, the P\'{o}lya group of $K$, denoted by
$Po(K),$ is the subgroup of the ideal class group $Cl_{K}$ generated by the
ideal classes of the products of prime ideals of same norm. The number field
$K$ is said to be P\'{o}lya if $Po(K)$ is trivial. Motivated by several recent
studies on the group $Po(K)$ when $K$ is a totally real bi-quadratic field, we
investigate the same with five distinct odd primes ramifying in $K/\mathbb{Q}$.
This extends the previous results on this problem, where the number of distinct
ramified primes was at most four.
